citation.article-title: Dictyoglomus thermophilum gen. nov., sp. nov., a chemoorganotrophic, anaerobic, thermophilic bacterium.

p.s: Dictyoglomus (Dic. ty. o. glo' mus. Gr. n. dictyon net; glomus L. n. ball; L. n. Dictyoglomus net ball)
Cells are gram-negative rods with a gram-negative type of cell surface structure, often forming bundles and large spherical bodies.
The bundles and large spherical bodies consist of two to several cells and several dozen cells, respectively, and are surrounded by a common outer wall membrane.
The G+C content of the type species is 29 mol%.
The type species is Dictyoglomus thermophilum.
